title: I was right behind Rory Stewart — and am glad Boris has left us gloomsters humiliated
text:
85 days ago, Boris Johnson stood on the steps of Downing Street and declared of those dismissing his impending renegotiation attempt as ‘doubters, doomsters and gloomsters’; “The people who bet against Britain are going to lose their shirts, because we’re going to restore trust in our democracy”, he told the country. I have been left completely shirtless, and humiliated in my pessimism about Boris’s renegotiation attempts: I am delighting in the humiliation of being proven wrong.

I didn’t merely disagree with Boris, but expected him to be a disaster; which is why during the Tory leadership campaign, I put my university degree on hold to join Rory Stewart’s campaign team. In between a whole lot...
